abstract: The sale would be the second-largest domestic initial public offering by a mainland Chinese bank.
snippet: The sale would be the second-largest domestic initial public offering by a mainland Chinese bank.
lead_paragraph: Industrial Bank of China, partly owned by a unit of HSBC Holdings, may raise up to 21.25 billion yuan ($2.74 billion) from a Shanghai share sale, making it the second-largest domestic initial public offering by a mainland Chinese bank.

headline.main: Industrial Bank of China Plans Sizable Share Sale in Shanghai
headline.print_headline: Industrial Bank of China Plans Sizable Share Sale in Shanghai

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
